definition: end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular

sentences.english: The modern superficies systems stem from Roman Law.
sentences.chinese: 近现代地上权肇端于罗马法。

sentences.english: The method of painting lies yet in the "eight fundamental strokes of writing."
sentences.chinese: 绘画的笔法，其基本且肇端于书法的“永”字八法。

sentences.english: It was against this backdrop of racial tension that the civil war began.
sentences.chinese: 这场内战肇端于种族之间的紧张状态。

sentences.english: This paper lodges that the ancient books colophon began in Hart Dynastys letters, appeared in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 论文提出古籍牌记肇端于汉简，出现于唐代。

sentences.english: If there was ever an economic crisis, they could be a source of instability.
sentences.chinese: 如果一旦发生经济危机，他们会是不稳定的肇端。

definition: lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
start and development/thread (of a story)/general outline/clue
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
to build (for the first time)/to create (a building)
change of dynasties/clear out the old, bring in the new
